title: Find Median from Data Stream
description:
The median is the middle value in an ordered integer list. If the size of the list is even, there is no middle value, and the median is the mean of the two middle values.

Implement the MedianFinder class:
- MedianFinder.new initializes the MedianFinder object.
- add_num(num) adds the integer num from the data stream to the data structure.
- find_median returns the median of all elements so far as a float.

Example:
  mf = MedianFinder.new
  mf.add_num(1)
  mf.add_num(2)
  mf.find_median  # => 1.5
  mf.add_num(3)
  mf.find_median  # => 2.0

Constraints:
- -100000 <= num <= 100000
- There will be at least one element before calling find_median
- At most 50000 calls will be made to add_num and find_median

test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

class TestFindMedianFromDataStream < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    mf = MedianFinder.new
    mf.add_num(1)
    mf.add_num(2)
    assert_equal 1.5, mf.find_median
    mf.add_num(3)
    assert_equal 2.0, mf.find_median
  end
  def test_single
    mf = MedianFinder.new
    mf.add_num(5)
    assert_equal 5.0, mf.find_median
  end
  def test_even_count
    mf = MedianFinder.new
    mf.add_num(1)
    mf.add_num(2)
    mf.add_num(3)
    mf.add_num(4)
    assert_equal 2.5, mf.find_median
  end
  def test_negative_numbers
    mf = MedianFinder.new
    mf.add_num(-1)
    mf.add_num(-2)
    assert_equal(-1.5, mf.find_median)
    mf.add_num(-3)
    assert_equal(-2.0, mf.find_median)
  end
end
